content.description: A low short steep face with some big holds and some little holds.
content.location: The middle of Stand Off Pinnacle

content.description: Shotgun Love is a fun line near the left side of the the Center Slab.  The route is not very straight at the bottom because it incorporates the easiest sections in the locale of the upper easy crack and face. Rests are frequent on this line along with big holds.
content.location: The route starts below the left end of the ledge left of the big flake.  After getting stood on the ledge move right to the zone with the ledge at outstretched hand height and climb up onto it.  From here the climb angles left to the left side of the Center Slab until reaching a crack/gully that it follows until the flakes near the lowering anchors.

content.description: Pyramid Scheme is a sustained difficulty vertical face of crimps and side pulls.
content.location: 2nd left most route on the Center Slab.

content.description: Pyramid Power above the ledge looks more a crack climb for a brief bit but the thin cracks useful lieback lips are brief and the crux is above that deceptive zone.
content.location: This route begins on the left end of the Center Slab's left ledge up leftward to a  brief crack and onto face moves.  The upper face briefly follows Shotgun Love but leaves to the left for the anchors.

content.description: Pulling the Trust Plug is easy face climbing on both ends with the hard crack up move being passing over the chockstone.
content.location: Follow the easy ramps on the left side of the Center Slab until making an exit for the chockstone roof.

content.description: Mostly steep beautiful face climb above the 2 crack moves with very positive pinches and the rest is tight crimps.
content.location: Near the left most side of the Power Tower Wall.

content.description: The route moves through the steeper face above the left corner of the ledge and then angles slightly right going "straight" to a mild overhanging head wall where a final bolt protects the traverse upward and to the left to the anchor finish.
content.location: The route is on the Center Slab and begins on the left side of the ledge.

content.description: High Step Transformer needs some high stepping to transform your location to easier standing than under the bulge.
content.location: 3nd line from the left.  The routes beginning is just to the right of where the wall is undercut.

content.description: Hedging follows a line under a buff colored roof and exits to the right on easier face and then moves left to the low anchors that server the other 4 routes to the left.
content.location: Hedging ascents to and thru the small buff colored zone of rock that is under a small roof and is on the left side on the ledge that is in the center of the center slab base.

content.description: Harold is Banging Something is an overhanging route with crack holds and some surprising burly pulls.
content.location: Begin just right of the prow after walking past the Big Grotto's limstone base.

content.description: Fun Hog is a 90 feet route on the Center Slab. It's upper half is steep with large holds and some arete like moves. The start is the left facing corner but it can be climbed by stemming, crack or face moves to the ledge. Next is a chimney to negotiate and then you are on the long face.
content.location: Fun Hog is on the right side of the Center Slab but it starts on left side of a 30 feet high flake the forms a chimney with the main wall above a ledge at about 15 feet above ground.

content.description: Field Effect Switch requires crossing the threshold of a bulge with poor feet and using holds within lunge reach.  Once on this big hold the route moves right over steep turf and then back left to anchors.
content.location: This one pitch climb is the 4rd from left on the Center slab's left side overhanging zone.

content.description: Escher Stair is about a dead vertical wall with 3 stair step roofs.  Excellent moves.
content.location: About the center of the left face of Switchbax Wall below a series of roofs.

content.description: Drama for SNAGS first encounters a short section of in your face steep crimp climbing, then travels an easy section of mild mannered moves, but then next tests your manner of interaction with the need for careful countering, and then it off to easy loping.
content.location: Begin on the left most line of bolts on the steep left face of the lower center wall.

content.description: Cow Trails II angles up a ramping series of ledges rightward until a flake on the left separates from the wall and one can layback up it to the anchors.
content.location: Begin at a 5 feet pointed boulder on the left side of the center wall.

climbs.name: Cow Foot Trail for Sheep Thrills

content.description: The Cow Foot Trail for Sheep Thrills is the easiest route on Switchbax Wall.  The route ramps up and right over blocks and then to ledges with several re Peats.
content.location: It begins on left side of the center slab.

content.description: Confronting Anxiety angles up and right into a shallow crack system but is mostly mostly edges for holds and shares the anchor with the 2 routes to the right.
content.location: Climb to the ledge top at the left side of the Stand Off by one of the 4 ways.  The bolts lead to some cracks just left of center on the upper face.

content.description: Sort your way through a large group of holds choosing those that match your knickknack needs.  Is the climbing easier to the left of the bolts or follow the bolt line,  maybe right?
content.location: Begin on left facing corner on the left side of the Stand Off Pinnacle.

climbs.name: Blue Haired Level Headed Bar Maid

content.description: Steep face on mostly big holds but with lot rests.
content.location: Level Headed Dancer begins just at the boundary of where the right side of the limestone below the Big Grotto meets the red rock.

content.description: Auctioneer Barmaid has a short steep section and then moves nearer and meets the route to the left.
content.location: 2nd route to the right of the white limestone outcrop where the caves are perched

content.description: Ally Ally Oxen Free is the long route on the right slab which is just left of the grotto area. Climb the outside of the slippery low corner and over some blocks to the bottom of the right slab.  On the face some of the holds may be hiding,
content.location: Begin on the right side of Stand Off Pinncle

content.description: Doing A Stroll Through Time will cover some Mississippian age limestone with chert crystals for holds, and after you overtake some fossil snails you get to the overhanging corner that is readily stemmed and some big holds to exit to the rap bolts.
content.location: A Stroll through Time begins just right of center of the large grotto area on the limestone.

pathTokens: Area 5:  Red and White Grotto Walls
